default: (a) One martial weapon you have proficiency with (and a quiver with 20 ammunitions is needed) or a quarterstaff
(a) Two simple weapons or (b) a simple weapon and a shield.
(a) A dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

classFeatures.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: Primordialist have affinity for one element. Choose one: Air, Earth, Fire or Water. This element will determinate some of the features a primordialist gains through levels. You learn the Primordial language and it gives the you these other abilities:

entries.name: Elemental Adaptation
entries: From 1st level, your affinity lets you adapt better to certain conditions:

entries.name: Air
entries: You are surrounded by a small breeze that keeps you dry and fresh all the time.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Your skin gets a thick and rough layer that make you look tougher and resilient, this makes you avoid one point of bleeding damage every round.

entries.name: Fire
entries: You feel warm in natural cold environments that are not magical or impossible to live.

entries.name: Water
entries: You are never thirsty if you have been in presence of water within a week.

entries.name: Affinity Expanded Spells
entries: From 1st level, you gain access to a expanded spell list, the cantrips and affinity spells from your element are added to the primordialsit spell list.

entries.caption: Affinity Spells
rows: Dancing Lights, Sacred Flame, Word of Radiance

entries.name: Affinity Extra Spells
entries: When you gain a new spell slot level from 1st though 5th level, you learn one extra spell that match the spell level of the new spell slot. This spell must be of your affinity element as shown in the class spell list. These spells can not be change.

classFeatures.name: Doctrine
entries: At 1st level, as a Primordialist you get a doctrine: or you become an Elemental Warrior or you become an Elemental Shaman. Each Doctrine is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice will grant you extra features at 3rd, 6th and 14th level. Some of the features granted by the doctrines will be determinate by the elemental affinity you choose.

classFeatures.name: Elemental Magic
entries: The Primordialist use her connection with elemental spirits to produce magic as elemental spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the Primordialist spell list. You learn additional Primordialist´s cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Primordialist table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Primordialist table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these primordialist spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. For example, if you know the 1st-level spell Burning Hands and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast burning hands using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: The Spells Known column of the Primordialist table shows how many spells you have known and when you learn more primordialist spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level. Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Primordialist´s spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Primordialist´s spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your primordialist spells. The power of your spells comes from communing with elemental spirits. You use your Wisdom whenever a primordialist spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a primordialist spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Elemental Conjuration
entries: Any primordialist´s summon conjuration spell calls an elemental creature. This summons is elemental subtype instead of any choice the spells give. This doesn’t change the base stats or abilities of the creature

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a Primordialist Focus (see the Player´s Handbook chapter 5 for druid focus) as a spellcasting focus for your primordial spells.

classFeatures.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain power lend by elemental spirits, this power come as a number of points. When you spend a spell slot of 1st to 5th level to cast a spell that is of the same element of your affinity or is a general type spell, you gain a number of spirit power equal to the spell slot level used. You can gain a maximum of spirit power equal to your Primordialist level this way and they wear off when you finish a long rest. Spells in the primordialist spell list are taged by their respective element.

classFeatures.name: Callings
entries: Primordialist excel in calling for aid to elemental spirits to help him and his allies, or make his magic powerful. At 2nd level you make a bond with elemental spirits. These elemental spirits let you call for them with your spirit power to help you.

entries.name: Learning Callings
entries: At 2nd level, you learn three callings. You can learn callings that their minimum costs are equal or less of your maximum spell slot when you learn or replace them. You learn additional callings as shown in the Callings Known column in the Primordialist table. In addition, whenever you gain an odd level in this class, you can replace one of callings you know with a different one of your choice.

Some callings do not have a cost, but they have a class level and/or a spell as prerequisite. You can learn these callings if you have that level and spell known. If you choose to replace the spell when you level up, the calling lost its function until you change the calling too.

entries.name: Using Callings
entries: The calling specifies the type of action and number of spirit power it requires. It also details whether you must concentrate on its effects, how many targets it affects, what saving throws it requires and if it requires an attack.

For area of effect, saving throws, attacks roll and combination of effects, use your spellcasting ability and the rules for Spells, as presented in chapter 10, “Spellcasting,” of the Player’s Handbook. Active a calling doesn’t require the components that many spells require. Using a calling requires no spoken words, gestures, or materials.

Some callings use concentration. These callings have a “conc.” word inside the parenthesis with a duration after it when they have a concentration requirement and use the same rules for concentration on spells, as presented in chapter 10, “Spellcasting,” of the Player’s Handbook. This rule means you can’t concentrate on two callings abilities at the same time nor one spell and one calling abilities.

entries.name: Calling Cost
entries: Most callings have the spirit power cost appearing in parentheses after its name and you must spend that number of spirit powers to use that calling. Those with a spell as prerequisite are boost for those spells and don´t requires extra spirit power. Some options show a range of spirit powers, rather than a specific cost. To use that, you must spend a number of spirit power within that range.
The maximum spirit power cost to activate a calling must be equal to the higher spell slot you can use up to 5th level.

entries.name: Calling Options
entries: The following are the calling options you have:

entries.name: Acid Wound (2 sp).
entries: As a reaction when you take piercing or slashing damage, you cause acid to spray from your wound; each creature within 5 feet of you takes 3d6 acid damage.

entries.name: Animate Elements (4 sp; conc., 1 hr.).
entries: You can cast the Conjure Elemental spell but only for elementals from your affinity element.

entries.name: Aura of Bloodletting (3 sp; conc., 1 min.).
entries: As a bonus action, you unleash an aura of rage. Until your concentration ends, you and any creature within 30 feet of you has advantage on melee attack rolls.

entries.name: Blaze Feet
entries: You can make the shape of the Wall of Fire spell with your movement, making it take the shape you want. You can take the Dash action as bonus action when you cast the spell and all your movement on the round you cast the spell determinate the long and shape of the wall.

entries.name: Blurry Wind (1 sp).
entries: As a bonus action, you take the Dash, Disengage or Dodge action.

entries.name: Burn Away (1 sp; conc., 1 min.).
entries: As a bonus action, choose up to three allies you can see within 60 feet of you. Until your concentration ends, each target have a +1 bonus to spell attacks and DC.

entries.name: Chromatic Overload
entries: When you cast the Chromatic Orb spell you can choose to use this different effects depending on the element picked.

entries.name: Acid
entries: You can make it a 15 ft. cone instead. Those in the area must make a constitution saving throw or get 3d6 acid damage. Damage increasing at higher level is 1d6.

entries.name: Cold
entries: If you hit the target he gets his speed halved until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Fire
entries: The target catch on fire getting 1d6 fire damage for a number of rounds equal to the spell level used.

entries.name: Lightning
entries: The target is restrain until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Poison
entries: The target is poisoned until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Thunder
entries: The target is pushed 10 ft. away from you and is knocked prone.

entries.name: Clouding (1-5 sp; conc., 10 min).
entries: As an action, you conjure clouds to create a solid and translucent, simple structure like a ramp, a wall, a stair or so, which lasts until your concentration ends. The structure can fills up to a 20 feet wide, high and length. You can make the structure increase its size by another 10 feet in every direction per spirit power spent.

entries.name: Cold Iron Shield (2 sp; conc., 1 min).
entries: As an action you gain resistance to spells. You have advantage on Saving Throws made against spells and spells effects.

entries.name: Deep Healing (5 sp).
entries: You can cast the Heal spell once per long rest but the spell heals 10 less hit points.

entries.name: Elemental Crashes
entries: When you cast your shock spell, the first attack against the chosen target dealt an additional 1d6 damage of the choosen element per spell slot used with the spell to a maximum of a 5d6.

entries.name: Energy Immunity (3 sp; conc., 1 min.).
entries: As an action, you can touch one creature and give it immunity to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice), which lasts until your concentration ends.

entries.name: Feral Spirits
entries: Once in the duration of the concentration on the Conjure Animals spell, the creatures can make one of this effect each:

entries.name: Bash
entries: Every creature you summon can stun one creature they hit with an attack. The creature have to do a constitution saving throw or be stunned for one round.

entries.name: Spirit Blend
entries: As an action, the creatures can heal you or a companion within 30 ft. of the creature for 3d8 hit points or his remaining hit points, whichever is lower. The creature disappears after heal the ally.

entries.name: Flashlight (1-5 sp).
entries: As a reaction, you can impose disadvantage on an attack roll against you if you can see the attacker. If the attack still hits you, the attacker takes 2d8 radiant damage and 1d8 per extra spirit power use beyond one.

entries.name: Flying Wind
entries: You don't need to concentrate on the Fly spell when cast only on yourself. The duration of the spell remains the same.

entries.name: Frozen Rain (3 sp.).
entries: As an action, choose a point you can see within 120 feet of you. The air in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point becomes deathly cold and saturated with moisture. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, a target takes 5d6 cold damage, and its speed is reduced to half for one minute. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage. You can increase this effect’s damage by 1d6 per each additional spirit power spent on it.

entries.name: Healing Tide
entries: When you cast Cure Wounds as a 2nd spell level it can heal a second target for 1d4 plus wisdom modifier within the range of the spell. If you cast it as a 3rd level it can heal a third target for 1d4 plus wisdom modifier. Each healing increase for 1d4 per spell level above 2nd and 3rd level respectively.

entries.name: Ice Sheet (1 sp).
entries: As an action, choose a point on the ground you can see within 60 feet of you. The ground in a 10-foot radius centered on that point becomes covered in ice for one minute. It is difficult terrain, and any creature that moves more than 10 feet on it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. If the surface is sloped, a creature that falls prone in the area immediately slides to the bottom of the slope. You can have only one of this effects active at a time.

entries.name: Knock Back (1-5 sp).
entries: You use your reaction to use this calling when you hit a target witha melee attack. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked 10 feet away from you in a straight line per spirit power spent. If it hits an object, this movement immediately ends and the target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage for one spirit power spend plus 1d6 per extra spirit power spent after one.

entries.name: Meteor.
entries: Your Fireball spell knock prone those who fail its save.

entries.name: Mighty Leap (1 sp).
entries: As part of your movement, you get impulse by earth on your feet jumping in any direction up to 20 ft.

entries.name: Mindless Charge (1 sp).
entries: As a bonus action, choose up to three creatures you can see within 60 feet of you. Each target can immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed in a straight line toward its nearest enemy. To avoid this effect the creature must make a charisma saving throw.

entries.name: Moonburn
entries: Your Moonbeam spell leave a trail when you move it, this trail shine radiant energy for one round. Any creature trespassing or starting his turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or get 2d10 radiant damage.

entries.name: Returning Wind (1sp)
entries: When you get hit with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a single attack to that foe.

entries.name: Ride the lightning
entries: When you cast the Lightning Bolt spell, you can teleport to an unoccupied space reached by the line of the spell.

entries.name: Rock Shield (1 -5 sp).
entries: As a bonus action, you make the skin of a creature hard as rock. Choose yourself or a companion and that creature gains 1d8 temporary hit points per spirit power spend.

entries.name: Soothing Dew (1 sp).
entries: As a bonus action, you can conjure a small dew that heals you or your allies. This dew last for 2 rounds and heals one ally you chose in 30 ft. of you in your turn. The creature regains 2d4 hit points the first round and 1d4 following round(s). You can spend extra spirit power to make the dew last one extra round or heal 1d4 hit points to another creature every round the dew last per extra spirit power spend.

entries.name: Spear of Light (2 sp).
entries: As a bonus action, you create a floating spear of light in 60 ft. of you that lasts for one minute or until you use this ability again. When you create it, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the spear. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier radiant damage.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spear up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

As an action, you can toss the spear to a creature, if you target an enemy you make a range spell attack, if you toss it to an ally you heal his wounds. You damage the target for 3d8 radiant damage plus 1d8 per extra spirit power used after two, or the same amount as healing to your ally. After you toss the spear it disappear.

entries.name: Static Strike (4 sp).
entries: As an action, you can make a lightning bolt leap from your hands to three targets in 60 ft, they must be within 20 feet of each other. The targets of the bolt can be a creature or an object and can be targeted only one time each. The targets must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 7d6 lightning damage and get stunned until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a targets takes half as much damage and are not stunned. Per additional spirit power spent on it, the bolt jump to an extra target.

entries.name: Steel Shield
entries: You can also cast your Shield spell on an ally in 30 ft. from you.

entries.name: Telekinetic Barrier (5 sp; conc., 10 min.).
entries: As an action, you create a transparent wall of telekinetic energy, at least one portion of which must be within 60 feet of you. The wall is 40 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 inch thick. The wall lasts until your concentration ends. Each 10-foot section of the wall has an AC of 10 and 40 hit points.

entries.name: Teleporting Wind (5 sp).
entries: You can use the Teleport Spell once per long rest, but you can target up to two creatures.

entries.name: Tremorsense (3 sp; conc., 10 min.).
entries: As a bonus action, you gain tremorsense with a radius of 30 feet, which lasts until your concentration ends.

entries.name: Water Barrier
entries: You can also cast Absorb Elements spell on an ally within 30 ft.

entries.name: Wind Step (2 sp).
entries: Once per turn, you can hit an enemy with advantage, and you can move one allies with a powerful wind. Choose an ally who can see or hear you, she can use its reaction to make a Dash action. If you hit the enemy with the attack, your ally doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from it with this movement.

classFeatures.name: Doctrine feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain another feature from your Doctrine.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Doctrine feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain another feature from your Doctrine.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: At 10th level you gain resistance to one kind of elemental damage, pick one from the two of your element:

entries.name: Air
entries: Lightning or thunder damage.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Acid or bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Fire or radiant damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Cold or piercing damage.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Doctrine feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain another feature from your Doctrine.

classFeatures.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: From 15th level, you can cast Investiture of spells one time per long rest without spending spell slots, and you don’t need concentration to maintain the spell.

entries.name: Air
entries: Investiture of Wind

entries.name: Earth
entries: Investiture of Earth

entries.name: Fire
entries: Investiture of Fire

entries.name: Water
entries: Investiture of Water

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Elemental Body
entries: Starting at 18th level, the primordial magic that you wield causes you to age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.  Also, you don't need to sleep nor eat, and you are not affected by magic that makes you sleep.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Ascendanse
entries: From 20th level, when you roll for initiative, and you have spend all the spirit power you can gain by casting spells, your regains 5 spirit power..

subclassFeatures.name: Elemental Warrior
entries: An Elemental Warrior is a Primordialist that  know how to mix his elemental magic with his martial capabilities.

entries.name: Elemental Warrior's Proficiency
entries: When you choose this doctrine at 1st level, you gain proficiency with Martial Weapons.
Your hit point increases by 1 per level in this class.

entries.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: From 1st level you learn how to deliver your spells from your weapons. As an action, you can make a special attack or attacks, depending on the spell, with a weapon you are holding. This attack deliver any spell you know that uses a spell attack and have casting time of one action, the attack uses your weapon attack and damage modifiers, and the weapon range instead the spell range. Once peruse of this special attack, you can choose to replace one of the spell damage dice to apply all the weapon damage dice instead.

This action counts as an attack action, but you can´t use the Extra Attack feature with it. Range and melee attacks rules apply, even for replace one of the multiple attacks granted by a spell to use the grapple or shove action (Player’s Handbook Chapter 9 Combat).
Most damage cantrips get better when you reach a certaing character level. When you use this ability, your class level is the one which determinate the improvements on those cantrips.

entries.name: Elemental Shroud
entries: From 3rd level, the elemental warrior will shroud himself with elemental energy. This energy will let him take advantage of his affinity in combat.

entries.name: Air
entries: When you score a critical hit, or reduce to 0 hit points an enemy creature with a weapon attack, you can choose to gain 2 temporary spirit powers. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 7th level, you get two temporary spirit power when you finish a long rest. Starting at 15th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn. Temporary spirit power are not comulative and are the first to be consumed.

entries.name: Earth
entries: As an action, you can spend one spirit power to become resistant to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from non-magical sources for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom or Constitution modifier. Starting at 7th level, you can activate this feature as a bonus action and it last for another extra 2 rounds. Starting at 15th level, it last for another extra 2 rounds.

entries.name: Fire
entries: As a bonus action you expend one spirit power and you engulf yourself in fire. When you activate this ability and as a bonus action on your turn for the next minute, all creatures in 5 ft. of you, must make a Dexterity saving throw, using your spell casting ability. The targets takes 1d8 Fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 2d8 at 7th level and 3d8 at 15th level.

entries.name: Water
entries: When you do cold damage with a spell or a calling, you can spend one spirit power to freeze the targets. Targets affected by the spell or the calling ability are grappled until the end of their next turn. Starting at 7th level the targets are restriened instead. Starting 15th level the targets are stuned instead.

entries.name: Elemental Unleash
entries: From 6th level, you learn to unleash your elemental power to bust your combat capabilities even further:

entries.name: Air
entries: You gain the ability to augment your weapons with air by sharpening them. As a bonus action, you can expend 2 to 4 spirit power to grant weapons you hold a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to the spirit power spend minus one for one minute.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You can use an action to blend yourself with the ground, this reduce your movement by half while blended. When you are blend to the ground you cannot be knocked prone and enemies moving in your melee reach provokes attacks of opportunity from you. Un-blend yourself is a bonus action. You lose this bonus if you stop touching ground.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Expending one spirit power, for the next minute, you can make one weapon you wield to emanates sunlight while you wield them. You radiates bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, and any undead in the bright light have disadvantage on attacks rolls and dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Water
entries: When you are healed by a spell you regain 2 extra hit points per spell slot used.

entries.name: Elemental Battery
entries: At 14th level, you can charge an elemental battery with your attacks. Once per round, when you manage to hit a hostile enemy with a weapon attack, you can charge your elemental battery.

You can have up to 3 charges. Once you have three charges, instead of charge your battery in that round, you can discharge all three charges to change the casting time of one spell or calling from an action to a bonus action.

subclassFeatures.name: Elemental Shaman
entries: An Elemental Shaman is a Primordialsit dedicated in raw elemental magic. Your reservoir of Spell Known, Cantrips Known and Spell Slots change.
Use the Sorcerer table for Spell Slot per Spell Level, and for Cantrips and Spell known.

entries.name: Ritual Caster
entries: From 1st level you can cast any primordialist spell you know as ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

entries.name: Damage Adaptability
entries: From 1st level, you can change the type of damage of one spell you cast that dealt acid, cold, fire, lightning, radiant or thunder damage to another type of that list. You must finish a short or long rest to use this feature again.

entries.name: Calling Master
entries: At 3rd level you gain an extra calling ability. This calling must be from the same element of your Elemental Affinity. If you want to change this calling when you get an odd level in this class, the new calling must match your affinity element as well.

entries.name: Fullmination
entries: From 6th level, you boost your cantrip depending on your affinity element. You add your wisdom modifier to the following:

entries.name: Air
entries: Lightning and thunder damage cantrips.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Acid and bludgeoning damage cantrips.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Fire and radiant damage cantrips.

entries.name: Water
entries: Cold and necrotic damage cantrips.

entries.name: Shamanism
entries: From 14th level, you can spend more spirit power with callings that let you spend additional spirit powers to increase its potency to a maximum of the higher spell slot you can cast per calling use, and you must spend all the spirit powers when you decide to use the calling; you can’t spend additional powers once you see the calling in action.

entries: Gate and True Resurrection.

entries.name: Level
entries: 5th Level.

entries.name: School
entries: Conjuration.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: 1 Action.

entries.name: Range
entries: 150 feet

entries.name: Components
entries: V, S, M (a vial of stomach acid from a poisonous creature).

entries.name: Duration
entries: Instantaneous.

entries.name: Description
entries: You create 4 hydra heads made of acid. Every head jump to a 5 ft. square point, in a 60 ft. of you. For each head, creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 5d10 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Objects in the area start to melt getting 2 points of permanent and cumulative damage per head every round for one minute.

entries.name: At Higher Level
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create one additional head.

entries.name: Level
entries: Cantrip.

entries.name: School
entries: Evocation.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: 1 Action.

entries.name: Range
entries: 90 feet

entries.name: Components
entries: V, S.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Instantaneous.

entries.name: Description
entries: You hurl bolt of energy at a creature or object that you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder for the type of bolt you create, and then make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes 1d8 damage of the type you chose.

entries.name: At Higher Level
entries: The spell creates more than one bolt when you reach higher levels; two bolts at 5th level, three bolts at 11th level, and four bolts at 17th level. You can direct the bolts at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each bolt.

entries.name: Level
entries: Cantrip.

entries.name: School
entries: Transmutation.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: 1 Action.

entries.name: Range
entries: 5 feet

entries.name: Components
entries: M (a weapon and shield).

entries.name: Duration
entries: Instantaneous.

entries.name: Description
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack, against one creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target gets The attack normal damage and the creature get bash with your shield getting an extra force damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: At Higher Level
entries: The spell's shield bash damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level, 11th level, and 17th level.

entries.name: Level
entries: Cantrip.

entries.name: School
entries: Conjuration.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: 1 Action.

entries.name: Range
entries: 10 feet

entries.name: Components
entries: S, V.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Instantaneous or 1 hour.

entries.name: Description
entries: You can briefly control elemental forces nearby, causing one of the following effects of your choice:
- Create a harmless, instantaneous sensory effect related to air, earth, fire, or water, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, a spray of light mist, or a gentle rumbling of stone.
- Instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
- Chill or warm up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
- Cause earth, fire, water, or mist that can fit within a 1-foot cube to shape itself into a crude form you designate for 1 minute.

entries.name: Level
entries: 1st Level.

entries.name: School
entries: Evocation.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: 1 Bonus Action.

entries.name: Range
entries: 90 feet

entries.name: Components
entries: V.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Concentration, up to 1 hour.

entries.name: Description
entries: You shock a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 elemental damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack, pick one from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. Also, the first time you hit the creature, and when you score a critical hit to it, for the duration of the spell, you inflict one effect depending on the damage chosen:
- Acid: The target is poisoned until the end of its next turn.
- Cold: The target is grappled until the end of its next turn.
- Fire: The targets its blind until the end of its next turn.
- Lightning: The target is can not take reactions until the end of its next turn.
- Thunder: The target is pushed 10 ft. away from you.
If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to shock a new creature.

entries.name: At Higher Level
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

entries.name: Level
entries: 2nd Level.

entries.name: School
entries: Conjuration.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: 1 Action.

entries.name: Range
entries: 60 feet

entries.name: Components
entries: V, S, M (a feather of an owl or an eagle).

entries.name: Duration
entries: Instantaneous.

entries.name: Description
entries: Choose a point you can see within the range to create a tornado. Winds howl in a 10-foot-radius and 20 ft. tall cylinder centered on that point. Each creature in the cylinder must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 4d6 bludgeoning damage and be moved to an unoccupied space of your choice in the pillar dimensions, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any loose object in the sphere is moved to an unoccupied space of your choice within it if the object weighs no more than 100 pounds.

entries.name: At Higher Level
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.
